properties.name: 1 - Walla Walla County Jail
properties.description: Posted by UnionbulletinThe arrested suspect is issued a citation and booked into the County Jail. Typical bail for a fourth-degree assault charge, which is a gross misdemeanor, is set at 00. If held overnight on a Sunday through Friday, the suspect is brought before District Court Judge John Knowlton the following morning at the jail. Unless the defendant is a recent, repeat offender, Kowlton usually allows release under provisions of a no-contact order. The order is in effect until the final outcome of the case unless the victim asks that it be terminated. The order tells the suspect not to contact th evictim in any way. The suspect is also told to appear in cour on an upcoming Monday at 1 p.m. or 3 p.m. Walla Walla County Jail

properties.name: 1- County Jail
properties.description: Posted by Unionbulletin300 W. Alder St., Walla Walla, WAThe arrested suspect is issued a citation and booked into the County Jail. Typical bail for a fourth-degree assault charge, which is a gross misdemeanor, is set at 00. If held overnight on a Sunday through Friday, the suspect is brought before District Court Judge John Knowlton the following morning at the jail. Unless the defendant is a recent, repeat offender, Knowlton usually allows release under provision of a no-contact order. The order is in effect until the final outcome of the case unless the victim asks that it be terminated. The order tells the suspect no to contact the victim in any way. The suspect also is told to appear in court on an upcoming Monday at 1 p.m. or 3 p.m.

properties.name: 3 - District Court
properties.description: Posted by UnionbulletinAt the defendant\'s first court appearance, which usually lasts literally only a minute or two. Judge Knowlton will inform the suspect of the applicable constitutional rights. He also will appoint one of several attorneys - under contract with the county, but located at various private offices in the area - to represent the defendant if he or she can\'t afford to hire one. An arraignment date for a couple of weeks in the future. At the arraignment the defendant most often pleads not guilty and a trial date is set. By law, the trial must be scheduled for within 60 days of the arraignment date if a defendant is in jail: 90 days if the defendant is out. Walla Walla County District Court

properties.name: 4 - City Attorney's Office
properties.description: Posted by UnionbulletinThe defense attorney contacts the City Attorney to request specific information about the case. Attorneys on both sides examine evidence, discuss the case and try to reach a resolution, commonly called a plea bargain.

properties.name: 4 - Prosecuting Attorney's Office
properties.description: Posted by UnionbulletinThe defense attorney contacts the Prosecuting Attorney to request specific information about the case. Attorneys on both sides examine evidence, discuss the case and try to reach a resolution, commonly called a plea bargain.

properties.description: Posted by UnionbulletinVictims and their children can seek shelter at the YWCA, and avail themselves of advice and support from a multitude of programs offered by the non-profit agency.
